Newtons laws of motion.State newtons first law of motion: Every body remains in a state of rest or constant velocity in a uniform line unless acted upon by an unbalanced force
Newtons laws of motion.State newtons third law: When A applies a force on B, B will apply a force that is the same in nature and of equal magnitude but opposite in direction on A

Horizontal circular motion.In what direction does a centripetal for: Towards the centre of a circular path

Conservation of energy and momentum.What is momentum: The product of the mass and velocity of an object that indicates the difficulty it has in stopping
Conservation of energy and momentum.State the formula for momentum:
P = MV 

P = Momentum (kg ms^-1) 
M = Mass (kg) 
V = Velocity (ms^-1)
Conservation of energy and momentum.What does the law of conservation of mom: In any collision or interaction between two or more objects in an isolated system, the total moment of the system will be conserved. That is, the total initial momentum will be equal to the total final momentum
Conservation of energy and momentum.What is a collision: A situation when two objects interact and exert action-reaction forces on one another
Conservation of energy and momentum.What is an isolated system: A system in which no forces external to the system act between the objects of the system
Conservation of energy and momentum.What is mechanical energy: Energy associated with the motion and position of an object
Conservation of energy and momentum.What is the law of conservation of energ: A universal law that states that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only tranformed and transferred
Conservation of energy and momentum.What is gravitational potential energy: The energy that an object gains due to its posistion in a gravitational field
Conservation of energy and momentum.What is kinetic energy: The energy an object has due to its motion
